question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
Newton’s method is defined by \(x_{n+1} = x_n - \frac{f(x_n)}{f'(x_n)}\), where \(x_n\) is the \(n\)-th approximation to a root of \(f\).

We are given that \(x_1 = -1~\). Applying the equation above,

\[\begin{aligned} x_{1+1} &= x_1 - \frac{f(x_1)}{f'(x_1)} \\ x_2 &= -1 - \frac{f(-1)}{f'(-1)} \\ &= -1 - \frac{(-1)^7 + 4}{7(-1)^6} \\ &= -1 - \frac{-1 + 4}{7\cdot1} \\ &= {\color{blue} -\frac{10}{7}}\end{aligned}\]
